bug.short_desc: Command conqueror UI inconsistencies

long_desc.thetext:
I20060919-0010
The command conqueror has a few UI inconsistencies.. conventions that should probably still apply to a forms-based dialog.
- The clear filter icon button for the top-left text field is always visible. In other places it only appears when applicable. - Button and checkbox text should be capitalized. See the "clear" button under File -> New and the "track selection" checkboxes under Dialogs -> Open Message Dialog.
Also, another minor oddity - I've noticed it shows the number of parameters in the heading, like "Parameters (1)" if there's one parameter. Do we need this? I just find it adds confusion.

My observations:
1) There is a need for some negative space here - the margins are too small. We need more space between the edges of the dialog and the sections, the sections themselves, and the sections and the buttons (also the occasional links that appear above the buttons. All these widgets need more space to breathe than they have now.
2) The composer needs to be self-evident in its function. Right now it is pretty utalitarian, which begs the question of why using the forms at all if it is mostly a 'dialog with the white background and links' :-).
2) When I type in some filter text, the 'X' image link stays gray, implying that it is still disabled, but when I hover over it, it switches to the color image. It should not.
3) The 'Collapse All' image should probably be moved up to the section header.
Addressed the above observations / inconsistencies. Feel free to reopen if you want to add more.

bug.short_desc: EclipseCon 2006 site down

long_desc.thetext: This may be related to the recent Buzilla upgrade on the EclipseCon site, but http://www.eclipsecon.org/2006/ is not working.

Unfortunately, there was an attack on the EclipseCon 2006 website (which runs Tomcat) and it was reasonably successful and so the site will remain down (sigh) until at least next month when it comes up to the top of the webmaster@ queue. Sorry about that.

bug.short_desc: When importing remote log files the CBEs are created in an XMI agent although large resource on Derby was configured

long_desc.thetext: Configure an embedded Derby database, and run a remote log import, for example import a remote Apache access log. The CBEs will be created in an XMI agent instead of an RDB agent.
Defer these defects to 4.4 because they can't be contained by end of day today and they're not on any critical list.
We need to fix this in 4.4, Marius can you take a look at this one.

Raising this to P1 since it's major usability issue. If a user intends to import a remote large log into Cloudscape the surprise is that the log will be serialized in XMI, and he would eventually end up with an OutOfMemoryException if he tries to load that resource in the log view. Marius please address this if possible.

I can't reproduce this defect.
Importing a large log file will add the records to the database (DB size prior to import was ~5MB; increased to ~700MB after). Importing a small log will import into the XMI agent as expected.

I can still reproduce the problem with the M6 candidate driver (TPTP-4.4.0-200703270100A). If the log is remotely imported using the agent controller the an XMI resource is created in the workspace instead of an rdb resource.
It works on my machine. Please reopen if you still see the problem.
The problem that I see with TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100 is that the agent (which is indeed an rdb resource now) is empty.
I am reopening this defect although the initial problem seems to have been fixed but still not 100% since no records are resgistered in the rdb log agent.
*** Bug 189485 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=69384) Patch for eContainer
Patch reviewed by Alex.
Fix in CVS.
Verified with TPTP-4.4.0-200706070100.
Closing.

bug.short_desc: [variables view] Preferences action should use PreferencesUtil to open pref pages

long_desc.thetext:
The Preferences... action for the variables view should use the PreferencesUtil method createPreferenceDialogOn(String, String[]) to open the 3 associated pref pages instead of creating the three pages and opening the dialog, etc. This way the respective paths of the pages are shown and filtering is available.
JDT Debug has a proxy to createPreferenceDialogOn with SWTUtil.showPreferencePage(String, String[]).

Created an attachment (id=50516) patch
the fix to the bug, placed call to SWTUtil.showPreferencePage instead of creating pages, opening dialog, etc.

released to HEAD
see SWTUtil and VariableOptionsAction in jdt.debug.ui
please verify Darin W
Verified.

bug.short_desc: Static method descriptor fails if the static method parameter class is inactive

long_desc.thetext:
Since the static method descriptor try to initialize as soon as it got created, it might fail to get the class type of the context parameter; as a result it will consider it just Object.class which will case this provider to be considered as a passive provider and ignored for the rest of the session
Of course this is a problem because the provider is ignored even if the context became valid later. Another problem is that se spend time initializing the static method descriptor while it might not be invoked at all, which affect performance and memory consumption
Static method descriptor should be lazy initialized, this will fix both problems
the same fix should be doen to the method descriptor
fixed
*** Bug 158647 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

In a model, I have two elements to which I applied the "ParameterizedElement" stereotype. My problem is the following: When I want to set the value for "reference", a drop down box appears that presents me the two available elements. A screenshot of the situation can be found on http://www.vanidle.com/~mies/temp/umlprofile.png

bug.short_desc: [hotbug_request] [commonArchive] SaveFailureException when updating binary modules

long_desc.thetext:
Affiliation: IBM
This is a hot bug because it is a regression; this worked in WTP 1.0.2
Our headless tool imports an ear file as a project, and projects are created for any contained ejb jar files, but any other files are left as binary jars/wars etc. in the ear project.
The tool needs to update the manifest classpaths of any of these binary modules which contain ejb refs. The tool finds the refs by calling
earFile = (EARFile)earEdit.asArchive(true); ejbRefsMap = earFile.getEJBReferences(true, false);
and it then uses common archive to update the binary modules.
This worked in WTP 1.0.2, but in WTP 1.5, an error is reported when we try to save the changes we have made:
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.exception.SaveFailureException: IWAE0017E Unable to replace original archive: C:\eclipse\ws\runtime-ejbdeploy\1d941be5\EarContent\TransferJMSClient.jar at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.impl.ArchiveImpl.cleanupAfterTempSave(ArchiveImpl.java:322) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.impl.ArchiveImpl.saveAsNoReopen(ArchiveImpl.java:1182) at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.impl.ArchiveImpl.saveNoReopen(ArchiveImpl.java:1206)
After setting breakpoints at various locations in common archive, it looks like the call to earFile.getEJBReferences(true, false) is leaving the archive open, which is causing this error.
Jason can you take a look?

This bug is because the EAR file is opening archives for the modules. When the EAR file is closed the file locks on the modules will also be closed. This is working as designed. I spoke with John and suggested a workaround to fix his code.
closing.

bug.short_desc: [Mac] F11 key mapping conflict on Mac OS X

long_desc.thetext: It looks like bug 57052 has returned. With Eclipse 3.2 (running on Mac OS X 10.4.7 on Intel Mac), F11 is mapped to "Debug Last Launched", which conflicts with Mac OS X "Show Desktop". According to the notes for bug 57052, the mapping was supposed to be changed to Command-F11.

The problem appears to be due to the two key bindings for M1+F11 in debug.ui/plugin.xml. For platform="carbon", M1+F11 maps to DebugLast. For unspecified platforms, M1+F11 maps to RunLast. Running on a Mac, removing the <key /> block for the latter gives the correct results.
My guess is that the code that processes the <key /> blocks is not giving priority to the platform-specific mapping when resolving duplicate mappings.

bug.short_desc: Version conflict - Commons Logging

long_desc.thetext:
TPTP Runtime 4.2.0.1 contains: eclipse features org.apache.commons_logging.feature_1.0.4.v200605300321--08422828353873 plugins org.apache.commons_logging_1.0.4.v200606131651
If it is just TPTP on eclipse, it does not create any problem. But when i add WTP to it, the eclipse configuration shows a red mark, because WTP also contains the same plugin, but the one in features folder is a later version.
WTP Runtime 1.5.0 (wtp-R-1.5.0-200606281455.zip) contains: eclipse features org.apache.commons_logging.feature_1.0.4.v200606152055--08422828353873 plugins org.apache.commons_logging_1.0.4.v200606131651
i.e. TPTP has commons v200605300321 and WTP has v200606152055.
So, eclipse/features ends up having both. When i launch eclipse and click on Help->Software Updates->Manage Configuration, WST appears with red cross and when you check the status in properties, you will find the following:
The feature is not configured properly. Reason: Included feature "Apache Commons Logging" version "1.0.4.v200606152055--08422828353873" is disabled.
Please advise!

I am part of the IBM Autonomic Computing Toolkit team and we need to ship these plugins together with IES for installing the LTA and ACT plugins. We are already in External beta and a quick response would be highly appreciated, thanks.

The two commons logging features point to the same plugin. Although we have tried to synch up the version numbers of these shared features, this one was missed. The duplication of these features causes no harm to the install. But if you are shipping these projects as a product, you can consider removing one of the features - keep the one with a newer timestamp.
The problem does not exist in TPTP 4.2.1, and it's unlikely to have another TPTP 4.2.0.x patch release. I'm setting the resolution of this bug as WONTFIX.

I haven't done any checking to see where we're getting the parser from and who else might be using it.
Rob

bug.short_desc: Need a separate Ad-hoc SQL execution handler

long_desc.thetext:
This is related to BZ144834 and BZ156829.
Currently - ExecutionService.createCallableSQLResultRunnable(..) is used to create a Execution handler when a Procedure is invoked - ExecutionService.createSimpleSQLResultRunnable(..) is used to create a Execution handler when a Function is invoked - ExecutionService.createSimpleSQLResultRunnable(..) is used to create a Execution handler when a Ad hoc SQL is executed from Routine Editor using context menu.
My suggestions are - rename them to createStoredProcedureRunnable(), createFucntionRunnable() and introduce a method named createAdHocScriptRunnable() to handle ad-hoc script execution.
Fixed as suggested. The original methods in ExecutionService has been deprecated.
See Hui's comments above
Seems ok now

bug.short_desc: Plugins View needs FilteredTree love

long_desc.thetext: The filtered tree would be a nice addition to our widely used (and loved) plug-ins view.

Created an attachment (id=50591) Brute Force filtered tree
This adds a basic filtered tree to the registry view.
It has bad performance.
PW

It filters the tree, but doesn't expand the filtered nodes. I think this has to do with RegistryBrowserContentProvider, which doesn't implement a getParent(Object element) ... without that, the tree viewer can't expand the tree to a given node.
PW

It would be interesting to see if this performs better now with the change to FilteredTree (see bug 128233). Chris, would you have time to look at the RegistryBrowserContentProvider, and why it does not return parents?

Created an attachment (id=53342) org.eclipse.pde.runtime.patch
updated patch

fixed.
The performance is fairly snappy. I'm getting about a 1 second search delay for 120 bundles on my T60.

T60? that does not reflect reality or what the average developer owns.
Devastatingly handsome PDE leads have a T40 only.

bug.short_desc: Shared connection closed after a function execution

long_desc.thetext:
The following call in org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.routineeditor.launching.SPLaunchConfigurationDelegate passes closeCon=true (3rd arg) which causes the shared connection to be closed in the handleEnd() method.
postrun = f.getExecutionService(), .createSimpleSQLResultRunnable(debuggeeCon, LaunchHelper.constructFinalSQLString(configuration),true, target, null, databaseIdentifier,configuration, null);

Fixed. Now in SimpleSQLResultRunnable, if the "closeCon" parameter is true, ProfileUtil.closeConnection will be called, which will check whether the connection is the shared connection before closing it.
See Hui's comment's above.
Seems ok now

bug.short_desc: M5 build: Workbreakdown for CP, cant select and extend a CP Subprocess item, worked OK in M4

long_desc.thetext: Workbreakdown for CP, cant select and extend(variability) a CP Subprocess item. This worked OK in M4 when these items were categroised as Basic Building blocks. The preload 'BUP' CP Phase Iterations seem to have been set up through selecting and extending the Sub Process items?

This has been fixed in the latest RC1 and RC2 nightly builds. Please verify this using those builds. If the issue still exists, please open a bug against RC2, and please details the steps how to reproduct.
fixed, verified on RC2-N20060927-1825
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Custom Categories Presentation name parse problem during publish

long_desc.thetext:
Custom Categories Presentation name will filter out DBCS chars before publish and will use it as navigator tree file name. It will cause the following problem:
1. Create 2 categories with same Presentation name, the second one will cover the first one during publish, only 1 category can be shown in publish site. 2. Create 2 categories, the first named "[DBCS char1]_Test", the second one named "[DBCS char2]_Test" as Presentation name, the second one will cover the first one during publish, only 1 category can be shown in publish site, it's the same problem as problem 1. 3. Create a category named with [DBCS char] as presentation name, publisher will generate a ".html", the navagator tree will not shown because invalid link name.
has been fixed. Please verify.
verified in version epf-composer-1.0-RC2-N20060920-1805-win32 and fixed
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Spelling error in Local Replace Deep Copy warning

long_desc.thetext:
"need" not "needs"
Proposed text: "This operation will create a deep copy of the selected element as well as all of its dynamically linked child elements and text that you need to maintain youself from now on. Do you want to continue?"
Delivered the correct for the syntax error. Message replacement will be postponed due to translation windows passed.
fixed, verified in version 1.0-RC2-N20060927-1825 No warning now.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Schema content appear incomplete at different levels on DSE

long_desc.thetext:
I have a Schema representation as below
OracleSchema->Schema -synonyms:Synonym -otherUsers:Schema
(1) Navigating down the DSE from connection to database to a schema, it displays the content contributed by SQL Model and my content provider. This content includes a node OtherUsers depicting the representation mentioned above. This works fine.
(2) The issue is that the schemas that appear under OtherUsers shows only the content provided by my content provider and not from SQL Model as seen in attachment <bugno>-1.jpg.
The set retrieved using
Set enabledExtensions = contentService.findContentExtensionsByTriggerPoint(aParentElement);
seems to retrieve only my content extension during (2). I guess this is the cause for this issue.
The contents on DSE red circled are the ones contributed by extension's content provider and black circled ones are provided byt SQL Model's content provider.
Created an attachment (id=50523) the DSE view with this bug
Brian: Some interaction pattern with o.e.ui.navigator?
Anthos, what does your navigatorContent extension point look at for the plug-in providing the content you want to see? Specifically the triggerPoints?

My guess is that this is a problem with your navigator extension. Is the object selected an instance of Schema? If so, I don't understand why the extension manager would fail to find the default SQL model extension. One possibility is that you are using an enablement element as opposed to or in addition to a triggerPoints element.
Rob

(In reply to comment #3) > Anthos, what does your navigatorContent extension point look at for the plug-in > providing the content you want to see? Specifically the triggerPoints? >
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.navigator.navigatorContent"> <navigatorContent name="Database_Explorer_Oracle_Content_Extension" priority="high" activeByDefault="true" contentProvider="oracle.dbtools.connectivity.ui.explorer.providers.ServerExplorerContentProvider" labelProvider="oracle.dbtools.connectivity.ui.explorer.providers.label.ServerExplorerLabelProvider" id="oracle.dbtools.connectivity.ui.explorer.providers.ServerExplorerContentProvider"> <!--commonSorter class="oracle.dbtools.connectivity.ui.explorer.providers.Sorter" id="oracle.dbtools.connectivity.ui.explorer.providers.Sorter"> <parentExpression> <instanceof value="org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core.internal.ui.explorer.virtual.IVirtualNode"/> </parentExpression> </commonSorter--> <commonSorter id ="oracle.dbtools.connectivity.ui.explorer.providers.Sorter" class="oracle.dbtools.connectivity.ui.explorer.providers.Sorter"> </commonSorter> <enablement> <instanceof value="org.eclipse.datatools.modelbase.sql.schema.SQLObject" /> </enablement> </navigatorContent> </extension>
moving to future release pending an official design for extending SQL model content in the DSE.

Forgot to add..
the problem still remains after this change.
Still working with the platform team. Moving off to Ganymede.

bug.short_desc: Fix the 16-group limit for NFS [was: User nickb has too many ACLs/groups on dev.eclipse]

long_desc.thetext:
$ cvs ci -m "testing file permissions" features-emf.xml Checking in features-emf.xml; /cvsroot/callisto/org.eclipse.callisto.tools/build-home/features-emf.xml,v <-- features-emf.xml new revision: 1.18; previous revision: 1.17 cvs [commit aborted]: could not open lock file `/cvsroot/callisto/org.eclipse.callisto.tools/build-home/,features-emf.xml,': Permission denied
I've got group access to callisto-dev, so I should be able to update this file:
-r--rwxr--+ 1 david_williams callisto-dev 6159 2006-09-19 22:14 features-emf.xml,v

The server is not managed by simple file permissions but by ACLs. Here's a copy of an older mailing list message from the webmaster:
4. ACLs and committer access ============================
Committers and Project Leads using the SSH console should beware of using ls -l to determine file permissions and ownership. We use Access Control Lists (ACLs) on some directories to manage multiple group owners of files and directories.
You can run getfacl (dirname) to see the complete set of owners and permissions.

Daniel Megert earns major points for remembering that.
That being said, Nick, you're in 20 groups now, which causes a problem for NFSv3's stupidly retarded limit of 16.
Anyway, you're good to go with Callisto, but the last four groups listed here could be problematic in the future. If there are groups you don't need to be in, let me know and I'll remove them.
Groups (20): xsd,emf-dev,xsd-edit,emf-edit,emf-home,xsd-home,uml2-home,uml2-releng,emft-dev,emft-home,emftadmin,emft-eodm,emft-net4j,emft-releng,emft-jet,emft-build,callisto-dev,modeling-home,modelingadmin,emft-teneo

Actually, it's 21 groups, but several are overlapping or redundant.
Project groups I need (committer for 2 projects):
emf (is this the same as emf-dev? or the equivalent of a *admin account, dating to before the *admin convention was started?) xsd (shouldn't this be called xsd-dev? or rolled into emf since they're the same project now?)
Web groups I need (5 websites):
emf-home, xsd-home, uml2-home, emft-home, modeling-home (xsd-home could be rolled into emf-home; no need to have these owned by 2 different ACLs/groups; in fact, you could remove eclipse.org/xsd from being in CVS and replace it with an redirect to eclipse.org/emf)
Releng groups I need (2 projects - I guess EMF doesn't have a separate group for releng?):
uml2-releng emft-releng
Admin groups I use (3 projects):
* callisto-dev * emftadmin (create new folders in /cvsroot/technology/org.eclipse.emft/, which could be done by opening a bug instead) * modelingadmin (create new folders in /cvsroot/modeling/, which could be done by opening a bug instead)
Groups I've probably never used (5):
emf-dev (how's that different from group emf?) emft-dev (how's that different from emftadmin?) emft-build (how is that different from emft-releng?) xsd-edit (?) emf-edit (?)
Groups that are useful, but not strictly required (4) - I'm not a committer, but having access makes doing releng work easier; perhaps if access could flow down from emftadmin I wouldn't need to be manually added to each new project as they're added:
emft-eodm, emft-net4j, emft-jet, emft-teneo
I'm also a committer for /cvsroot/eclipse/org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder/plugins/org.eclipse.build.tools/, but that apparently doesn't come a new group as well, just CVS access. ;-)
Renam, reassign, and downgrade bug as this is no longer a major Callisto issue.

I actually spent some time on this. Here's what I did:
- removed the emf group, and assigned all owned files to emf-dev. project-dev is a standard for us, so emf was redundant
- removed the xsd group, and assigned all owned files to emf-dev
- created emfadmin, as it's a standard for us. Assigned ownership to download.eclipse.org:tools/emf to emfadmin
- removed emf-edit and xsd-edit, as no files we owned by these groups
- removed xsd-home, and assigned all owned files to emf-home
- removed emft-build, as it didn't have any assigned files
One would need to examing the modeling project's directory structure vs. modeling groups, but one serious confusion point is the presence of modeling files in tools CVS and tools downloads area. I do believe you are working on this, but it would be great if modeling files could all be found under the modeling top-level project.
Thoughts?

(In reply to comment #5) > I actually spent some time on this. Here's what I did:
Looks great, thanks.
> One would need to examing the modeling project's directory structure vs. > modeling groups, but one serious confusion point is the presence of modeling > files in tools CVS and tools downloads area. I do believe you are working on > this, but it would be great if modeling files could all be found under the > modeling top-level project.
There are two moves that ought to happen, but will probably not happen immediately as I've got lots of other migrations on the go already. http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Modeling_Project_Releng_Plan
a) EMF: /cvsroot/tools/org.eclipse.emf, org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo, org.eclipse.xsd, org.eclipse.emf.releng.build --> /cvsroot/modeling/org.eclipse.emf/* b) EMFT: /cvsroot/technology/org.eclipse.emft -> /cvsroot/modeling/org.eclipse.*/* (split into the projects where the incubating bits will eventually live after they exit incubation)
(a) isn't urgent for me because nothing would change in terms of the outside world... though I can see it's "unclean" from your point of view, and I agree. ;-)
(b) this one's a work-in-progress. EODM and OCL have already moved into MDT. JET, JETEditor will be moved into M2T soon; Query, Transaction and Validation are moving soon into EMF, once I solve jar signing. The remaining 3 components are still incubating so as with EMF (no outside visibility), they're a low priority for me. New projects (emf.compare and emf.jcrm) are going to start in /cvsroot/modeling instead of /cvsroot/technology, which means once all the current work is done, we'll have just emf.emf, emft.teneo, emft.net4j, and emft.cdo left to move.
Regarding tools downloads area (old EMF downloads), I tried to purge everything but there was some blowback (read: a few open bugs) when the old update manager site disappeared and when links to zips moved. So I believe the resolution was to have old copies in the old places for now. If symlinking worked via the web, I could move and link from the old place to save space. Is there any way to implement a half-way solution here with .htaccess, like having symlinks be valid in some cases? Or, could I use hard links instead? I've never used them before but this article suggests this might be the solution, if it's allowable: http://linuxgazette.net/105/pitcher.html.
Back on the topic of group ids, I recently noticed something is amiss:
$ ll /cvsroot/modeling/ total 1.5K drwxrwxr-x+ 3 root 8428 1.2K 2006-11-01 13:33 CVSROOT drwxrwsr-x+ 2 khussey mdt-releng 80 2006-11-21 17:29 org.eclipse.mdt.releng drwxrwxr-x+ 5 khussey 8428 176 2007-01-05 09:17 org.eclipse.m2m drwxrwsr-x+ 12 khussey mdt-dev 456 2007-01-16 12:16 org.eclipse.mdt drwxrwxr-x+ 10 root cvs 304 2007-02-20 13:26 . drwxrwsr-x+ 7 pelder m2t-dev 264 2007-02-21 09:37 org.eclipse.m2t drwxr-xr-x 14 droy root 432 2007-03-05 14:25 .. drwxrwsr-x+ 10 emerks 8428 272 2007-03-23 17:05 org.eclipse.gmf drwxrwsr-x+ 6 emerks 8428 248 2007-04-09 17:44 releng-common drwxrwsr-x+ 12 emerks 8428 520 2007-04-13 14:26 org.eclipse.emf
What is group 8428?
Also:
$ groups nickb id: cannot find name for group ID 8069
Cheers,
Nick
I've tried to fix the missing groups as best I could.

Allow me to rename this bug to better reflect the problem. Currently, NFSv3's lame authentication (or at the very least, the one we have chosen) has a 16-group limitation that users can belong to. When authenticating a user's access to a file, only a users first 16 groups are communicated to the NFS server, leading to "access denied" errors.
We have examined a number of options, and have determined that the path of least resistance is to simply upgrade to NFSv4 with Kerberos authentication. We need to sandbox and test this correctly, but the move to NFSv4 is fairly low-risk, as we can simply revert to NFSv3 quite easily.

Although switching to NFSv4 is low-risk, the implementation of Kerberos is not trivial in our environment. After a couple of days of messing around with it in sandboxes, I still haven't accomplished much, despite wading through tons of new terminology and command-line tools. I'm sure it's probably just my lack of experience with Kerberos, but on to other things...
I downloaded a kernel patch that "fixes" the 16-group limit by simply anticipating which group the NFS server wants to see. In sandbox tests, the patch worked like a charm and I have compiled and installed a custom kernel on node1. Using Kim Moir's account (she's in 75 groups) I was able to access files that were owned by the 47th and 75th group she is in (carbon-ui and orbit-home) without using clumsy user-based ACLs. The same tests failed on node2 (Access Denied).
Chances are we'll drop the Kerberos/NFSv4 idea for now and simply maintain a patched kernel. Kerberos would be really nice to have for the vastly improved security, but for now we need something that works with minimal complexity.

This is now fixed, and all the ia64 nodes (CVS, downloads, etc) are running a patched kernel that bypasses the 16-group limit. I tested with Kim Moir's account, and even with the 75th group, her write access was maintained.
We'll no longer be maintaining ACLs.

bug.short_desc: [discussion] Make it easy to build up the context for new tasks

long_desc.thetext:
I have created a small flash animation to show my workflow problem: http://www.scharf.gr/eclipse/Probmens/Mylar/ContextProblem/
Here's the text version:
- I work on task FOO (let's say I implement a feature)
- Now I see something in the code that I think should be refactored (not directly related to FOO), but because I am working on FOO, I create a new task FIXME to remind me to do this.
- If I now switch to the newly created task FIXME, all my editors get closed. This makes sense if I switch to a task that has context, because mylar puts me in that context. But FIXME is a newly created task without context and I have to start building the context starting from zero. All my editors get closed and the expanded tree in the package explorer gets collapsed.
- This is annoying, because I have now to navigate back to the file I have found the problem that made me creating the new task FIXME.
- However. If I work with no task active, and I find something interesting and create a task FIXME, then I can activate FIXME a all my editors remain open. But working on no task is also annoying, because if I work on a task and I deactivate the task: BANG all my editors get closed.
Possible solutions: 1) When switching off a task (going into normal mode), don't clear the context. Have an action clean everything when no task is active. This could be done in the active task context menu: "Deactivate without closing editors". I could close the stuff I don't want, before I activate my new empty Task.
2) Have a button deactivate the current task without closing all editors. This could be done by a stop button in the task list. The only difference is that it deactivates the current task and does not close the open editors and the expanded items in the package explorer. Again, now I could close the stuff I don't want, before I activate my new empty Task.
2) Switching to tasks without context never cleans the context (like it does if you have no task active)
3) Copy the context from the old task to the new task.
My favorite is (1). Solution (20 is also good. Solution (3) would impact current users and solution (4) is not really helpful, because the I don't want the heritage of another task....
Michael

To me it seems that copying current context into new task (e.g. when new task created while some other task is active) does make sense and also quite natural.
All other suggested options seem way too specific to this workflow...

Copying context from one task to another sounds good to me. However, rather than always copying an active context, it would be better to add a new action: Clone Task. Always copying the context is probably not the right thing.
I think a button for option "2" (er, the first "2": keeping editors open) would be useful as well. I often forget to deactivate the current task before following a rabbit trail. When I remember, I would like to deactivate the task (to avoid polluting the context) but keep working in those editors.
If I had to choose just one, I think I would take the latter.
Within a few weeks we should have the copy/paste context functionality to experiment with. Once we all get some experience with that let's use this bug to discuss improving the workflow.
sounds good :-)

I also use Mylar extensively and have had this problem.
Personally, solution #3 seems like it would make the most sense, but I have the following suggestion:
- If I create a new task when there is another task already open, Mylar could prompt me if I want my task context from the current task copied into the new task.
I sometimes bulk-add tasks one after the other, forgetting to close the current task. It would be just as annoying to go to the other tasks later to find that they had copied the (irrelevant) context of the open task.
If I create a task with no existing task open, then Mylar wouldn't prompt me. So it would be easy to get rid of the prompt--just deactivate the current task, add the new ones, then reactivate the current task.

Michael: are you now using the copy/paste context to work around this? If so how is it working? The idea with adding that was to get people to experiment with it, since in one way or another all of your suggestions are related to copying context. We usually out what the right automation/streamlining is to add the manual support and get feedback on that. We could do some of what you and Dave are suggesting, but need to make sure this kind of context copying is the right way of "forking" the kinds of tasks that you describe, especially sine we're also considering what to do with subtasks and contexts (bug 137543).
Btw, regarding the steps in your video, note that all of the editors that were closed are still in your "Back" list on the toolbar. This is essential, because no matter what Mylar is doing with the context the navigation history persists, meaning that the last 10 open editors can always be opened.
Need to hear back on comment#6 to investigate further.

We have had very little feedback from users about using the "Copy Context To" functionality. However, this is still an open problem in 3.0 and bug 196751 might be helpful in providing a good 'seed' context when first activating a task.

bug.short_desc: [Patch] Apply Patch should be able to handle patches generated by diff

long_desc.thetext:
In trying to apply a patch for the EMFT site's migration to Phoenix, I've discovered that using Team > Apply Patch... does NOT work for patches containing updates to files not already in CVS.
Steps to reproduce:
0) check out www/emft from /cvsroot/org.eclipse as a new project called "emft", using a datestamp of BEFORE 2006-09-20. 1) right-click the project, select Team > Apply Patch... 2) select the patch file, hit Next > 3) select project emft, hit Next > 4) note that files such as _projectCommon.php are not listed in the Apply Patch wizard on page 3, so I can't create those files from the patch.
I'll attach the patch used to make it easier to reproduce this problem. Note that at some point in the future, the file _projectCommon.php will exist, so you'll have to extract from CVS using a datestamp BEFORE 2006-09-20.

Created an attachment (id=50526) patch to update EMFT site to Phoenix skin
The attached patch is the one used in the above steps to reproduce, giving an example of a patch containing new files which Eclipse does not create when applied.
Which build are you using? (Help->About Eclipse SDK, build id)
Eclipse 3.2 GM (eg., org.eclipse.platform_3.2.0.v20060609m-AgOexn6hlEUsvBO).

I tried out your scenario and I was able to reproduce what you saw (using the version on 2006-09-19).
However, I also looked at your patch and the format is wrong for the Apply Wizard to detect the new files (which is why _projectCommon.php doesn't show up). Did you create this patch from within Eclipse? I tried using the Create Patch wizard to pick up a new file and it worked no problem.
Finally, I should mention that we're planning to put in some support for manual merging of hunks that can't be applied into 3.3. This means that if you send a patch of a file that isn't in CVS to someone, he will be able to merge your changes in to any changes he has made, as opposed to the Apply Patch Wizard completely rewriting his version of the file. (Although life would be much easier for you if you would just commit the file...)

No, that patch was created with a 'cvs diff -u' followed by a 'diff -u /dev/null newfile' for each of the new files, as CVS's diff does not handle new files. I replaced each of the /dev/null entries with the file that was to be patched as Eclipse can't handle diffs against /dev/null either.
The standard 'patch' utility has no problems with the above use case and it is not particularly uncommon to add new files with a patch. Eclipse should be compatible with standard patches and not just with itself.

OK - I see what you did now, althought I'm not sure why you didn't use the Eclipse Create Patch wizard, which would have picked up the new files for you.
In either case, it is true that the Apply Patch wizard cannot handle patches created using the command line diff tool. We unfortunately do not have the manpower available to currently address this deficiency. If this is an important feature to you, we will happily accept a patch and test case.
In addition, the Apply Patch Wizard should also be able to work with patches that contain mixed CVS diffs along with diff tool diffs.

As a corollary to this, the universal diffs generated by cvs on Solaris (and probably other platforms) contain truly empty lines whereas the blank lines created by Eclipse's Create Patch wizard include a single space. Eclipse sees the CVS patches as malformed and cannot apply them. If I edit the patch so that each blank line has one space, then the patch works.
Here's an example (not an actual patch, but it gives you the idea):
Index: helloWorld.txt =================================================================== RCS file: /project/helloWorld.txt,v retrieving revision 1.2 diff -u -r1.2 helloWorld.txt --- helloWorld.txt 10 Oct 2006 21:17:32 -0000 1.2 +++ helloWorld.txt 19 Oct 2006 16:11:50 -0000 @@ -21,10 +21,9 @@ Some text here. Some more text preceding a blank line.
-The preceding line is blank when created with CVS diff. +The preceding line contains a single space if this patch is created with Eclipse Create Patch.

attachment.desc: patch to update EMFT site to Phoenix skin

bug.short_desc: [rulers] revision becomes sticky in unrelated editor

long_desc.thetext:
I20060919-0010
- check out org.eclipse.core.expressions from HEAD - open ElementHandler, show annotations in editor ruler - open EvaluationContext, show annotations in editor ruler - arrange editors to see both in one window - clicking on revision 1.1 (e.g. imports section) in either editor often toggles stickyness of the same revision in the other editor

This is due to the fact that the link between the history page and the ruler is currently installed and maintained by the AnnotateOperation itself. It does so by keeping track of parts being closed etc. etc.
Much better would be if the CVSHistoryPage would itself maintain the link to the editor matching its history contents. The annotate operation then only has to open the history view and the view will itself link itself to the editor's annotate display. Disposal also becomes much easier: whenever the input of the view changes, the selection listener is removed and readded for any matching editor found.
I will attach a patch - given its size, it may not be for 3.3.

Created an attachment (id=50574) org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui.diff
Patch against ShowAnnotationOperation.java and CVSHistoryPage.java. It removes the unnecessary code and a bunch of anyonymous classes from the first, and adds the needed complement in CVSHistoryPage.
One independent change in ShowAnnotationOperation is that when the history view is auto-opened, it does not take focus any more - something that was interrupting the flow when showing annotate information from the editor.

This change also depends on an addition on the text side of things that did not make it into M2 yet: The RevisionPainter (via RevisionSelectionProvider) must not only accept setting a selection as a Revision object, but also as a revision id String.

Re comment 1:
>AnnotateOperation Did you mean ShowAnnotationOperation?
>I will attach a patch - given its size, it may not be for 3.3. Really? Did you eventually mean 3.3 M2?

(In reply to comment #4) > >AnnotateOperation > Did you mean ShowAnnotationOperation? > > >I will attach a patch - given its size, it may not be for 3.3. > Really? Did you eventually mean 3.3 M2?
2 x yes. Thanks for proof-reading...
Once we have this in, we should also write up a Team wiki page that decribes how to do this.

I have released the patch with some pretty major modifications. Bascially, I create a RevisionAnnotationController class that handles the coordination between the history view and the ruler. I have also create a few FAQ entries to describe how to use the revision ruler annotation support. The information is pretty basic. Feel free to modify it if you like.
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Team_FAQ#Team_API_Questions
Tom, Feedback on the new API is also welcome. One question I have is whether Team is the right place for the API. I'm happy to keep it there but am willing to poush it down if there is value in that. There is a reference to some Team classes but they can be easily removed.

bug.short_desc: unreferenced module elements not instantiated

long_desc.thetext: oaw-classic, version 4.1 final: Affects at least the MagicDraw (11.5) ToolAdapert, others might be affected as well. I am using a profile module, containing a shared package with several classes and other elements that make up my DSL. Some of the classes defined in the profile are not directly referenced from any elements in my model, but are intended to be used from a ModelModifier that "weaves" these classes into my model. However, unreferenced elements from a module are currently not instantiated, so the ModelModifier has no access to them. --> Either always instantiate all module elements, or provide configuration option to enforce this for a specific module.
Karsten?
to old to be fixed :-)

Not too old, but won't fix anyway. This would really crash down performance. The XMIInstantiator is not performant for MagicDraw when loading referenced modules. When loading also those profiles that are not directly referenced I guess the whole thing becomes really unusable.
When using MagicDraw 11.5+ it is strongly recommended to switch to UML2 support. This will burst performance and provides a rich API to the UML metamodel.

bug.short_desc: [IDE] Open Referenced projects opens unpredictable list of projects

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Open Referenced projects opens unpredictable list of projects
Steps to Reproduce: I a workspace with several Java projects, all closed, open one project. On dialog "Should referenced Projects also be opened" click Yes.
Observed behaviour: The following situations may occur: 1. No other projects are opened 2. Sometimes only referenced project is opened 3. Sometimes multiple references projects are opened
It seems that somehow the list is based on projects which where open the last time the project was closed. However when closing several projects at once the result is unpredictable.
The current behaviour is unpredictable and gives a very unreliable impression.
In a specific example with some of my source projects: I had the following 4 projects (with about 20 others), all closed: - com.compuware.alturainfra - com.compuware.alturainfra.projects - com.compuware.alturainfra.licensing - com.compuware.moftoolbase When opening "moftoolbase" (which depends on the first 3) only the first two projects were opened. Then I manually opened the "licensing" project, closed all projects, after which open "moftoolbase", "Should ...?" opened all three referenced projects.

Does the set of projects that gets opened match the project references listed under Properties > Project References? I.e., I wonder if it is your project references that are not stable for some reason in your workspace.

No: in the dialog "Project References" all checkboxes were empty, both when the project was open and after I closed it (for my "moftoolbase" project), while two projects were opened this time after selecting "Yes" from the dialog when opening "moftoolbase": "alturainfra" and "alturainfra.licensing", so not "alturainfra.projects".

Probably easier to reproduce: I added EMF (Callisto 2.2.0 release) to my Eclipse 3.2 installation and proceeded with the first tutorial (http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/indextools.cgi/*checkout*/org.eclipse.emf/doc/org.eclipse.emf.doc/tutorials/clibmod/clibmod.html).
This results in 3 plugin projects: myEMFProject, myEMFProject.edit and myEMFProject.editor. The .editor plugin depends on the .edit plugin, which depends on the first plugin.
When all 3 project are open, I close the .editor project first and then close the rest, then open the .editor project and answer "Yes", the other two projects are opened. OK. Then I close the myEMFProject project, then the .editor, and finally the .edit project. Open the .editor project, answer "Yes" and only the .edit project is opened.

bug.short_desc: Stacktrace Link in Console doesn't support "Window Working Set"

long_desc.thetext:
I'm using the "Window Working Set" feature a lot. Everything (Package Explorer, Open Type, Launcher, ...) is configured to use it.
But when I press on a stack-trace link in the console it always opens the wrong file (not the currently selected working set). Is there a hidden selector for the "working set" of stack-traces or is it a missing feature?

Depends which console you are using. A stack trace from a program that has been debugged (i.e. the actual output from stderr), uses the source lookup path of the associated launch configuration. If you are pasting a stack trace into the "Java stack trace console", it searches the entire workspace for source, and does not consider the window working set.
the stacktrace was produced (written to console) by an application started with "Run as ..."

Then it uses the source lookup path associated with the application, which should open the correct source file - i.e. the source that is assocaited with the actually binary (assuming your source lookup path is correct). Source lookup is not tied to the working set feature - nor do we plan to tie it to that feature. Source lookup is controlled/determined by the kind of application launched and its source lookup implementation.
Marking as won't fix.

Hm, it's an application build and run in eclipse in workset "B" (otherwise I wouldn't get the stacktrace) but the source code opened is from workset "A" (not selected one).
I assume, that I don't have to select the source code path for an eclipse project, but only for external libs/applications?
Does the missmatch perhaps occur because I'm using maven to build the project and eclipse gets somewhat confused while starting the application?
What sort of launch configruation are you using?

"Apply Window Working Set(s)" is checked. Did you mean that?
I will check the next time it happens, if the "Source/Source Lookup Path" is not fiting to the selected working set for the given launch configuration.
Sorry, I mean what sort of application are you debugging, and what type of launch configuration do you use to launch it - Eclipse Workbench, Java Application, Java Applet, etc.?

Most of the time I use the "Run..." menu button and sometimes "Debug..." and start the Console applications as "Java Application".
They are predefined as "<name>.launch" files in the project, to share the start configurations with the other developers.

Source code to demonstrate the bug.

Can you attach a patch ? Or commit the fixed source to CVS ? I'm using the CVS source so that's not a problem.
It works, thanks.
Fix committed.

bug.short_desc: [Doc] 'aspects' vs. 'advices'

long_desc.thetext:
"I'm using OAW 4.0 RC3 but I found no differences to 4.0 final or 4.1 final.
I'm trying to work with the aspect-oriented programming. It doesn't work.
In the exsample r20_xPandReference.pdf page 14 is an example with aspects.
<component class="oaw.xpand2.Generator2"> <fileEncoding value="ISO-8859-1"/> <metaModel class="oaw.type.emf.EmfMetaModel"> <metaModelPackage value="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EcorePackage"/> </metaModel> <expand value="example::Java::all FOR myModel.get(0)"/> <!-- aop configuration --> <aspects value='example::Aspects1, example::Aspects2'/> <!-- output configuration --> <outlet path='main/src-gen'/> <outlet name='TO_SRC' path='main/src' overwrite='false'/> <beautifier class="oaw.xpand2.output.JavaBeautifier"/> <beautifier class="oaw.xpand2.output.XmlBeautifier"/> <!-- protected regions configuration --> <prSrcPathes value="main/src"/> <prDefaultExcludes value="false"/> <prExcludes value="*.xml"/> </component>
If I use the Generator org.openarchitectureware.xpand2.Generator I get the following error.
No getter or adder method for property 'aspects in clazz 'org.openarchitectureware.xpand2.Generator' found
If I try to use the Generator2 org.openarchitectureware.xpand2.Generator2 I get the error Class not found: 'org.openarchitectureware.xpand2.Generator2'
I looked in every version. There is no Generator2.java. And I looked in every generator for the propertie aspects. There is no such propertie. Is the documentation further than the programming? :-) or do I make something wrong?
sipi"
Take a look at the data model sample... it works there...
See Markus' comment above
documentation has been updated

bug.short_desc: MetamodelReaderPlugin doesn't compile

long_desc.thetext: The current CVS version (1.5) of MetamodelReaderPlugin.java is incomplatible with the latest changes to the XMIInstantiator class (version 1.15). The attached patch fixes the compile problem in MetamodelReaderPlugin.
Created an attachment (id=50554) Patch fixing compile error in MetamodelReaderPlugin

INVALID
Reason: a) In the patch an import was changed that lead to the compile error. b) The package is deprecated since it contains the "old" generator plugin from oAW3. This plugin is not used anymore. The package will be removed in oAW4.2.

Well, might be something wrong with my setup. I required the patch to make the latest sources from CVS compile on my system. Anyway, if it's going to be removed, I don't mind.
Regards, Florian

The tests are (at least for now) on http://fullmoon.ottawa.ibm.com/downloads/drops/I20060920-0010/testresults/html/org.eclipse.ui.tests_linux.gtk.x86_5.0.html

This was in the console log: [java] ----- testActionSets [java] testActionSets: setUp... [java] testActionSets: tearDown...
[java] !ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.core 4 4 2006-09-19 14:47:06.052 [java] !MESSAGE Background Indexer Crash Recovery [java] !STACK 0 [java] java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space [java] Exception in thread "Java indexing" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space [java] ----- testActionSetPartAssociations [java] testActionSetPartAssociations: setUp... [java] testActionSetPartAssociations: tearDown...
These tests are being run with 1.5.0_06 which has a known problem.
PW

Hmmm, it is a consistent OutOfMemoryError, but it doesn't actually say PermGen error .... maybe this is just a memory issue with the linux test machine.
Still investigating.
PW

As John pointed out, it might also be an eclipse regression where we're not freeing heap space.
PW

(In reply to comment #4) > As John pointed out, it might also be an eclipse regression where we're not > freeing heap space. > > PW
Or instances of TestCase that still hold on to lots of memory.
>Or instances of TestCase that still hold on to lots of memory. I don't think JUnit changed in a way from 3.2 to 3.2.1 that could cause this but adding Markus to be sure.
We only had very small changes in JUnit between 3.2 and 3.2.1, and I verified that they can be ruled out as a cause for these problems.

(In reply to comment #6) > >Or instances of TestCase that still hold on to lots of memory. > I don't think JUnit changed in a way from 3.2 to 3.2.1 that could cause this > but adding Markus to be sure.
I guess I should explain what I meant: As far as I know, JUnit holds on to the TestCase objects for the duration of all tests to produce the report. Therefore, any fields in subclasses of TestCase (i.e. UITestCase and its subclasses) should be nulled in tearDown.

First I'd compare with 3.2 or in other words: if you added new (or substantially changed) tests after 3.2 and they cause the potential leak then yes, 'null' it out in 3.2.1, otherwise wait until the real problem has been identified.

Even in 3.3, if I run the tests with 1.5.0_03 they all pass. If I run them with 1.5.0_06 then I get the OOME: Exception in thread "State Saver" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space Exception in thread "Java indexing" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
Karice, you were going to try the 3.2.1 tests with 1.5.0_06?
Later, PW

Haven't reached a conclusive result yet. Ran the 3.2.1 tests in M20060919-1045 with 1.5.0_06 vm and they all pass. I am going to try Dani's suggestion of comparing the 3.2.1 tests against the 3.2 tests and see what I get.
BTW, I20060920-0800 did not have the UI failures.
I assume Releng is using the eclipse.ini which specifies -vmargs -Xmx256m when running the tests via test.xml - Kim? If not, the UiTestSuite might just have been lucky so far.
Yes, we use the eclipse.ini with the same arguments.

It looks like this error (OOME) which leads to dynamic test failures is also in 3.2.0. I ran 3.2.0, 1.5.0_06 with the tests from R3_2, and I get a failure 3 tests later, also with: Exception in thread "Java indexing" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
I don't believe it is a regression on the quality of the current 3.2.1 build (or the I builds).
But the main cause still needs to be narrowed down, as this is a randomly occurring error on 1.5.0 (although it is more reliable recently).
Later, PW

Created an attachment (id=50641) Print used Mem numbers
Karice, here's a patch if you want similar output.
PW
You should trigger a garbage collection before printing the used memory.

Paul and I have found if we run the tests (3.2.0 and 3.2.1) with -Xmx256M -Xms40M (the defaults in eclipse.ini) then they all pass. If we run without these args the testActivityImages test fails. After printing out memory usage to the console, the mem usage for this test is at 63M. The OOME happens during this test so it seems the max mem for each test is 64M, rather than 256M. The UI tests uses org.eclipse.test/library.xml to specify some of its test properties, including vmargs, which is set to be an empty string. The default value the vm uses for max heap size when no properties are specified is 64M. I suspect if we add the following line to the UiTestSuite in the test.xml file of the ui.tests plug-in <property name="vmargs" value="-Xmx256M -Xms40M"/> then the UITestSuite will pass.
We should look at doing cleanup of the tests in the 3.3 stream so that we do not have to employ this strategy in that stream, but it seems less desireable to make lots of changes to the tests in the 3.2.1 stream at this point.

I talked to Andrew about this. Since we initiate the tests calling the startup.jar instead of the eclipse executable, the eclipse.ini is not read. It might be a good idea for us to pass the vmargs to the JUnit tests in the library.xml in the 3.3 stream, instead of just for the performance tests as we do today.
Note that the performance tests vm args are -Xmx256M and -Xms256M, whereas in eclipse.ini they are -Xmx256M -Xms40M

re comment 18: what's the memory diff between R3.2 and 3_2_maintenance build? If it is also around 64MB then I my guess in comment 13 probably applies re comment 20: the -Xms shouldn't matter in respect to OOME

bug.short_desc: [WorkingSets] New 'Add to working set' feature not intuitive

long_desc.thetext:
3.3 M2
In M2, the toolbar button 'working set' now has different behaviour depending on a.) a element is selected and a working set is configured as working set then it does an 'Add' b.) else it opens the edit dialog
This is IMO a UI blooper. The toolbar button should always do the same. It is not clear which element is added to which working set. What if the current element is a Resource working set and the element a Java element?
Also not clear to me is that what happens when two or more working sets are checked for the window working set. To which working set will the selected elements be added?
The menu should also always contain 'Edit' menu. It seems that it is gone when a.) is active.
I also agree that adding element to a working set is a unsolved problem. I don't have a simple solution. What about adding more entries to the menu: (> denotes a submenu)
New Working Set... Configure working sets.... (Was 'Edit...') Configure > myWorkingSet1 (Direct shortcuts) myWorkingSet2 myWorkingSet3
Add selection to > myWorkingSet1 myWorkingSet2 myWorkingSet3 Remove selection from > myWorkingSet1 myWorkingSet2 myWorkingSet3

Any news on this one?
Is it really planed to keep the toolbar buttons in 3.3? Sorry, but IMO it looks wrong to have these actions in a toolbar.
Also: 'Remove from Working Set' should only list the working sets the selected element is part of. 'Add to Working Set' should only list the working sets the element is not yet part of.
From my experience, working sets are most valuable as 'project sets'. Adding single resources/folders is nice too, but can lead to strange results when it isn't clear what's part of a WS and what not.
So a solution that is not too intrusive could be to offer 'Add to Working Set' in the context menu but only on projects. 'Remove from Working Set' makes sense to have in the package explorer when in working set mode.

I may revisit it after M6 but my time will be consumed by the new menu work until then. To quickly address some of your comments:
The add/remove behaviour you're asking about already exists - add will only be shown when the element isn't already in a given set, similar to remove.
I originally wanted to add these options into the context menu but wasn't able to - we have a moratorium on new context menu entries.
I like your idea for the configure submenu.

bug.short_desc: 'AbstractSearchDialog': Confusing name

long_desc.thetext:
M2
From the New and Noteworthy dialog I see that a 'AbstractSearchDialog' got added.
Note that this sounds like functionality from the search plugin, where we also have a search dialog (CTRL + H). I assume this is the 'open' dialog. In Java it it called 'Open Type' dialog. Or, probably more general, this is a element selection dialog.
I strongly suggest that we fix the name or at least hold back the New and Noteworthy entry until the naming is fixed.

How about we delete the N&N entry that introduces the new abstract class and instead mention in the entry about the new Open Resource... that functionality was pushed down from JDT/UI to Platform/UI and exposed as API?

I think this is a good compromise. We can change the name in M3 (I agree is it easy to confuse it).
Martin do you have a suggested name?

Maybe FilteredElementSelectionDialog?
Note that the class AbstractSearcher is an other class that should be improved. Its hard to find a good name as it seems to mix multiple functionality in one class. I didn't understand it when having a quick look at it. Definitly needs improved Javadoc.
I think that FilteredElementsSelectionDialog should be good name for this dialog. I will change it for M3.

Yes, you are right it needs improved javaDocs. I will add this. Generally I pushed down searching functionality from JDT/UI to Platform/UI. It's solution based on mechanism from TypeInfoViewer for searching elements. Now we can build type and resource searching facility using this common functionality from AbstractSearcher.

(In reply to comment #3) AbstractSearcher is not so complicated. It basically searches/filters elements based on filter params (setFilterParam). It provides extra informations for each searched element (getElementDetails), and gives elements which should be returned as a result of selection (getObjectToReturn). The second is because of JDT OpenTypeDialog. As you can see, elements which are on the list of "OpenTypeDialog" are different that elements returned as a result from the dialog. We introduced this method especially for your dialog :-)
If we are talking about name, maybe just ElementsFilter?

This generally looks OK to me - just a couple of comments
1) Fix the warnings. We are trying to ship with no warnings and most of them are to do with missing javadoc
2) FilteredItemsSelectionDialog really doesn't need the word Items. How about FilteredSelectionDialog ?
3)FilteredItemsSelectionDialog has the following comment. We should remove the reference to resources (use a more generic word like entries)
Shows a list of items to the user with a text entry field for a string * pattern used to filter the list of resources.

I've looked at the working set portion of the patch and it seems okay except that the fillContextMenu method added to the workingset action group should probably have a since tag. Yes, it isn't technically a new method but the behavior has changed radically.
fillContextMenu should actually have a non javadoc tag as it is defined in the superclass and a comment about the new behaviour.

Some comments
IDialogContentProvider - does it need to be an interface? If it was an abstract class than you have some flexibility to change it later. Do you expect people to implement it much? ContentProvider (the default internal implementation) is your only implementation. IDialogContentProvider is also too general a name and it is not a content provider. It would be nice if the UML2EcoreConverter would support tranformation of properties that are specified using the second of the above mentioned options also.

bug.short_desc: Can't re-import any data I export to CSV/TSV/XML/etc... (DB2 UDB/DTP 1.0M1)

long_desc.thetext:
Wierdly enough, I haven't found any bugs related to CSV import/export in the DTP buzilla section. Here's mine :
I've got 2 identical schemas on 2 different servers (1 dev server, 1 production server).
I want to export the data from the production server to the dev server using the CSV export function. The export works out fine (whatever the format, be it CSV, XML, plain text with customized separator-character, etc.).
When I try to re-import the exported file to the dev server, I always end up with either (CSV file) :
--------------------------- Data loading was successful.
0 row(s) loaded. 15 row(s) could not be loaded.
com.ibm.db2.jcc.a.SqlException: DB2 SQL error: SQLCODE: -407, SQLSTATE: 23502, SQLERRMC: ---------------------------- Which means "An insert or update value is null, but the column cannot contain null values" according to DB2's documentation.
or (customized pipe separated file) :
org.eclipse.wst.rdb.data.internal.core.load.DataFormatException: Unexpected number of values
My CSV file doesn't even contain any NULL's in it ... Since both schemas are exactly the same, I suspected that the CSV parsing code was a bit dodgy. Only you can tell me.
By the way, I can't seem to be able to do the same actions wether I export via the "Results" pane in the "Data Output" view (generated via a manuel query in an SQL scrapbook) or if I export via the "Right Click on table > Data > extract" panel.
Regards, Etienne.
This is WTP/rdb

John,
I moving this defect to DTP, this will be addressed as part of the sqltools defect fixes since edit/extract/load have been ported to DTP.
Der Ping
Will this be in 1.5 or "future"?

The Extract/Load function is very primitive in that the number of columns in the data to be loaded must match the number of columns in the table. If not, some column values might be set to null and would result in an SQL error if the particular column does not allow null value. Before I can reproduce the error, I need the following:
1) the data you are trying to Load(import). 2) the CREATE TABLE defintion so that I can recreate the table you are trying to import to.

bug.short_desc: AbstractModelActionDelegate$WriteCommand doesn't check if status is null

long_desc.thetext:
When an action doesn't set its status, org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.ui.action.AbstractModelActionDelegate$WriteCommand will throw a NPE in doExecuteWithResult().
The problem is in the line
history.closeOperation(status.isOK(), false, IOperationHistory.EXECUTE);
which is directly accessing status instead of using getStatus() which returns Status.OK_STATUS if status is null.
The fix is simply to use getStatus() instead.
Client has worked around the issue. Look at fixing in 2.0.

bug.short_desc: Race condition in PDOMTests

long_desc.thetext:
The IBM CDT Team is intermittently running into race conditions whenever we run the entire PDOMTests suite. Running individual tests passes all the time. Running the entire suite sometimes causes failures.
However, putting breakpoints at the beginning of each test case and running the tests in debug mode makes them all pass.
Steps to reproduce:
1) Install Eclipse 3.2 2) Check out all projects from HEAD/org.eclipse.cdt/all 3) Run PDOMTests as a JUnit Plug-in Test
On my primary workstation, all the tests pass all the time. Here's my environment:
- Intel Pentium 4 with Hyperthreading enabled - Sun JRE 1.5.0_06 - Windows XP SP2 - Eclipse 3.2
On Vivian's workstation, some of the tests fail some of the time. However, the first test always passes. Our workstations have identical hardware and software except she's using Sun's JRE version 1.5.0_08.
We also tried running the tests on other machines. These platforms also failed:
1) Athlon64 x2 - Linux x86_64 (kernel 2.6 SMP) - Sun JRE 1.5.0_06
2) Athlon64 x2 - Windows XP SP2 - Sun JRE 1.5.0_06
3) Pentium D 930 - Windows XP SP2 - Sun JRE 1.5.0_06
4) Thinkpad T42 - Windows XP SP2 - Sun JRE 1.5.0_06
I've also tried running the tests with IBM's Java 5.0 JRE.

I isolated the problem. The default indexer for CDT changed from PDOMNullIndexer to PDOMFastIndexer recently. The PDOM test cases assume the PDOMNullIndexer is active (i.e. indexing is disabled) so they manually index the projects (in PDOMTestBase.createProject()).
Now that the default indexer is PDOMFastIndexer, the PDOM test cases have 2 indexers running at the same time. This causes cycles to be created in the PDOM and other fun stuff :)
I'm preparing a patch for it. Looks to be a 1 line fix.
Just wanted to add that I wasn't able to reproduce this initially because I had a stale checkout in my workspace.

Yes, you are absolutely correct. When the project gets created, and with the default now being fast, the indexer kicks in in the background. I also try to run it synchronously and then the test accesses the index and I don't get a read lock. So there's a lot of bad things happening here. I'm not sure a one line fix will do it ;)

Fixed in HEAD.
The PDOM tests were horrible. It became really obvious when the default indexer changed to the fast indexer and the indexer was running many times on the project and lead to totally inconsistent results. I've made a bunch of changes to make things more deterministic. We should be O.K. now.

Since you seem to have forgotten to transition this to FIXED I have done so for you :-)
Jason please VERIFY.
Applied to 3.1.
Or maybe I wasn't quite done yet ;)
Verified on HEAD and cdt_3_1. Thanks very much.

I'm currently writing new plug-in test cases for the PDOM, and I'm getting intermittent failures in my test suite with the new changes.
It seems that because all the instances of the test cases share the same workbench (and as a result, the same IPDOMManager), setting the default indexer for the IPDOMManager in PDOMTestBase.createProject() is causing side effects when running my test suite.
I tried changing this around so that the newly created project's indexer is set to the PDOMNullIndexer before the project resources get imported via IPDOMManager.setIndexerId(cproject, id). This way, we don't need to set the default indexer on the IPDOMManager.
With this change, the failures go away completely.
I tried running the test suite again this morning and can't reproduce the failures I was getting last week so I'm changing this to FIXED again.
Actually, I like your suggestion better and did it that way in 3.1.1. I'll repopen this bug to make sure I remember to port the fix up to HEAD>
Hmm, now why didn't I assign this to myself before...

Created an attachment (id=51231) unit test for repeating the same test repeatedly to show differing results
i think there is one more race condition - (I've been seeing some further intermittent test failures). Trying to get a measure of the failure rate it looks like an incidence of about 3-14 in 100, although it can vary quite widely.
the problem seems to be that the null indexer calling PDOM.clear() can sometimes happen after the direct invocation of the fast indexer. My understanding is that the eclipse Job framework doesn't provide ordering guarantees, and that this is instead gained from logic in the PDOMManager.
Changing both the Null reindex, and the synchronous index (as part of createProject) to go through the PDOMManager queue looks to fix the problem by ensuring they happen in the desired order.
I've attached a patch for RaceCondition157992Test (an altered ClassTests) that shows the problem. It takes about 10 minutes to run though - so I haven't registered it in PDOMTests.

Created an attachment (id=51232) suggested fix for job ordering
this is the patch I've verified fixes the above, (both patches are against HEAD)
Doug, I have fixed this using Andrews patch. Andrew please verify that this works for you, I have never had these kind of problems.

thanks Markus, I'm still a little puzzled why no-one else saw these failures... - they happened both on my work machine (Win2K), and my laptop at home (WinXP), maybe I'm running more processes other than eclipse while testing
I've confirmed I don't get the failures on the HEAD branch now the fix is applied
I have fixed this a while ago.

bug.short_desc: Revisit the mechanism of poping up a dialog to show Sun licenses

long_desc.thetext:
When a user creates a Web/EJB/EAR project the very first time, the user will be prompted with the Sun license agreement. If the user decides to agree to the license, then the corresponding Sun J2EE schemas will be downloaded and cached in the user's workspace.
This mechanism raised some legal concerns. Adrian, can you comment in this bug what are the legal concerns and propose some alternative solutions that we can used to address these issues?
Our requirements (If anyone can think of other requirements, feel free to add to this list):
1. We cannot redistribute the Sun J2EE schemas (The Eclipse Foundation did not grant the approval). If we can redistribute them, then problem solved.
2. We need to somehow cache these schemas locally (for validation and for performance reasons).
Adrian recommanded we fix this in 1.5.2. If not, then 'must' fix in 2.0. Changing priority from P3 to P2.
Mving to xsd... I think Lawrence? was the main contributor to the cache/license mechanism... I'm not sure what action to take though.... short of asking the developer to download themselves?
Jeffrey, I don't understand what's being asked for? Adrian, what would be the appropriate behaviour here?

Hi Craig,
In short, poping up a dialog that shows the Sun J2EE schema license (when the first Web project is created) is not an acceptable approach according to Adrian. I don't know what alternatives we have, I'll let Adrian comment on that.

This is up to the EMO but there are three things that concern me:
a) Has this content (the schemas) and its corresponding license(s) been approved by the EMO just like any other third-party package? It should be.
b) I am concerned that lots of projects will start doing this and having their own mechanism for downloading and installing additionally licensed content.
c) Where is the license obtained from? If you have a local copy of it and it changes at the point of origin, that is not good.

1. No. That's why the end user must accept the license agreement. We've tried unsuccessfully to get the J2EE DTDs and schemas approved more than once.
Originally WTP simply cached these files (as all Web browsers do and have done for years) to assist the end user even though the files couldn't be shipped with WTP. As far as I remember the license dialog was the suggestion of and required by Eclipse legal.
2. This is an ugly hack from an end user point of view. I hope no other project needs to resort to this type of solution and I hope that one day WTP will be able to rid itself of this as well.
3. The license was obtained from the Sun website and a local copy is contained in a WTP plug-in to allow the license to be nicely formatted and displayed when there is no network connectivity.

Just to cross-document it, see also
https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=4

Marking as "won't fix" since I think no longer an issue, since we now redistribute dtd's and schema's in WTP 2.0 under CDDL.
Hence nothing more to do on this issue that I'm aware of.
Closing.

bug.short_desc: [compiler] ProblemReferenceBinding missing a closestMatch

long_desc.thetext:
In class BlockScope I found several occurrences of this snippet: if (!binding.isValidBinding()) return new ProblemReferenceBinding( CharOperation.subarray(compoundName, 0, currentIndex), null, // TODO should improve binding.problemId());
See e.g. method getBinding(char[][],int,InvocationSite,boolean)
To me it looks like the "null" could simply be replaced by ((ProblemReferenceBinding)binding).closestMatch The binding should be a ReferenceBinding in all these locations, so the cast should be safe (?).
If, e.g., the problemId() is NotVisible, other parts of the system should be allowed to assume that the problem binding has indeed a closestMatch, shouldn't they?
Definitily, visibility issues should still set the closest match to improve our resilience.
Created an attachment (id=52381) Proposed patch
RELEASED FOR 3.3M3. Fixed
Verified for 3.3 M3 using build I20061030-0010

bug.short_desc: Tools need Esc key handler override

long_desc.thetext:
With a GEF application displayed in an RCP ViewPart (not an EditorPart) and the view open in detached mode (torn away from the rest of the workbench window), pressing the Esc key dismisses the view. This is normal behavior for a view, but inappropriate *when the user is in the middle of a create operation from the GEF palette or drag-and-drop move in a GEF application*. In these cases, the Esc key should abort the operation in progress (as it does when the view part is attached to the workbench window), but not dismiss the view.
I attempted to subclass ScrollingGraphicalViewer and FigureCanvas to include an override, but the createControl(Composite) method on ScrollingGraphicalViewer is declared final, so I can't have a subclass of the one make a subclass of the other.
A stack trace captured from the ViewPart's dispose method is included for reference. The method FigureCanvas.translateTraversal(MSG) is in the stack prior to the shell being closed, so it should be possible to prevent the shell from being closed at this point.
Possible solutions to explore include: (a) modify FigureCanvas to override Control.translateTraversal(MSG) to ignore the Esc key when such an operation is in progress (b) modify FigureCanvas to allow application developers to hook in an event override function that can decide how to handle certain events, and override to call that function from translateTraversal(MSG) (c) override Control.translateTraversal(MSG) to simply ignore the Esc key.
Thread [main] (Suspended (breakpoint at line 281 in MyGEFView)) MyGEFView.dispose() line: 281 ViewReference(WorkbenchPartReference).doDisposePart() line: 659 ViewReference.doDisposePart() line: 94 ViewReference(WorkbenchPartReference).dispose() line: 628 WorkbenchPage.disposePart(WorkbenchPartReference) line: 1439 WorkbenchPage.partRemoved(WorkbenchPartReference) line: 1431 ViewFactory.releaseView(IViewReference) line: 237 Perspective.hideView(IViewReference) line: 498 WorkbenchPage.hideView(IViewReference) line: 2023 DetachedWindow.handleClose() line: 202 DetachedWindow.access$0(DetachedWindow) line: 194 DetachedWindow$1.shellClosed(ShellEvent) line: 65 ShellPool$2.shellClosed(ShellEvent) line: 67 TypedListener.handleEvent(Event) line: 159 EventTable.sendEvent(Event) line: 66 Shell(Widget).sendEvent(Event) line: 843 Shell(Widget).sendEvent(int, Event, boolean) line: 867 Shell(Widget).sendEvent(int, Event) line: 852 Shell(Decorations).closeWidget() line: 257 Shell.close() line: 430 Shell.traverseEscape() line: 1318 Shell(Control).traverse(Event) line: 2783 *** FigureCanvas(Control).translateTraversal(MSG) line: 2759 FigureCanvas(Composite).translateTraversal(MSG) line: 840 *** Display.translateTraversal(MSG, Control) line: 3577 Display.filterMessage(MSG) line: 933 Display.readAndDispatch() line: 2754 Workbench.runEventLoop(Window$IExceptionHandler, Display) line: 1699 Workbench.runUI() line: 1663 Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Display, WorkbenchAdvisor) line: 367 PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(Display, WorkbenchAdvisor) line: 143 Application.run(Object) line: 18 PlatformActivator$1.run(Object) line: 226 EclipseStarter.run(Object) line: 376 EclipseStarter.run(String[], Runnable) line: 163 NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Method, Object, Object[]) line: not available [native method] NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Object, Object[]) line: 39 DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Object, Object[]) line: 25 Method.invoke(Object, Object[]) line: 324 Main.invokeFramework(String[], URL[]) line: 334 Main.basicRun(String[]) line: 278 Main.run(String[]) line: 973 Main.main(String[]) line: 948

FigureCanvas is a Control. Add a traverse listener to the control. Set doit = false. The shell will not close. See SWT snippets for more info.
I don't see how behavior could be changed at FigureCanvas. But maybe some of the tools could change. Tools should already be receiving the traversal event, which could be "consumed" (doit=false) if it is ESC. Try extending DragEditPartsTracker and see if you can fix the case for MOVE.

>> But maybe some of the tools could change.
Following this tip, I ended up overriding PanningSelectionTool (for the drag and drop case) and copying and adding to the internal class PaletteSelectionTool (for the creation case). These changes are a sufficient band-aid for my case, but the tools in GEF should include similar handling.
Currently, the TargetingTool -> SelectionTool -> PanningSelectionTool and TargetingTool -> SelectionTool -> PaletteSelectionTool hierarchies do not provide implementations of AbstractTool.handleKeyTraversed(TraverseEvent), so the tools are receiving the event but only doing the no-op provided by AbstractTool.
For the PanningSelectionTool case, I think it would be appropriate for PanningSelectionTool to provide an implementation that either (a) sets event.doit to false if the event represents ESC and the tool is in its initial, terminal, or (perhaps) invalid state or (b) permits the current drag tracker to have some say in the decision.
For the PaletteSelectionTool case, I think it would be appropriate for the implementation to set event.doit to false if the event represents ESC and the palette viewer's active tool is not its palette root's default entry.
